item.title: Google Chrome uses AI to analyze pages in new scam detection feature
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Google is using artificial intelligence to power a new Chrome scam protection feature that analyzes brands and the intent of pages as you browse the web. [...]

item.title: Malicious Rspack, Vant packages published using stolen NPM tokens
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Three popular npm packages, @rspack/core, @rspack/cli, and Vant, were compromised through stolen npm account tokens, allowing threat actors to publish malicious versions that installed cryptominers. [...]

item.title: US charges Russian-Israeli as suspected LockBit ransomware coder
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The US Department of Justice has charged a Russian-Israeli dual-national for his suspected role in developing malware and managing the infrastructure for the notorious LockBit ransomware group. [...]

item.title: Sophos discloses critical Firewall remote code execution flaw
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Sophos has addressed three vulnerabilities in its Sophos Firewall product that could allow remote unauthenticated threat actors to perform SQL injection, remote code execution, and gain privileged SSH access to devices. [...]

item.title: Krispy Kreme breach, data theft claimed by Play ransomware gang
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Play ransomware gang has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack that impacted the business operations of the U.S. doughnut chain Krispy Kreme in November. [...]

item.title: Ascension: Health data of 5.6 million stolen in ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Ascension, one of the largest private U.S. healthcare systems, is notifying nearly 5.6 million patients and employees that their personal and health data was stolen in a May cyberattack linked to the Black Basta ransomware operation. [...]

item.title: Massive live sports piracy ring with 812 million yearly visits taken offline
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​The Alliance for Creativity and Entertainment (ACE) has taken down one of the world's largest live sports streaming piracy rings, with over 821 million visits last year. [...]

item.title: Romanian Netwalker ransomware affiliate sentenced to 20 years in prison
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Daniel Christian Hulea, a Romanian man charged for his involvement in NetWalker ransomware attacks, was sentenced to 20 years in prison after pleading guilty to computer fraud conspiracy and wire fraud conspiracy in June. [...]

item.title: BadBox malware botnet infects 192,000 Android devices despite disruption
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The BadBox Android malware botnet has grown to over 192,000 infected devices worldwide despite a recent sinkhole operation that attempted to disrupt the operation in Germany. [...]

item.title: Microsoft 365 users hit by random product deactivation errors
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft is investigating a known issue randomly triggering "Product Deactivated" errors for customers using Microsoft 365 Office apps. [...]

item.title: Android malware found on Amazon Appstore disguised as health app
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A malicious Android spyware application named 'BMI CalculationVsn' was discovered on the Amazon Appstore, masquerading as a simple health tool but stealing data from infected devices in the background. [...]

item.title: Juniper warns of Mirai botnet scanning for Session Smart routers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Juniper Networks has warned customers of Mirai malware attacks scanning the Internet for Session Smart routers using default credentials. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 24H2 upgrades blocked on some PCs due to audio issues
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has added another Windows 11 24H2 upgrade block for systems with Dirac audio improvement software due to compatibility issues breaking sound output. [...]
